snippet: Pitcher Masahiro Tanaka told his Japanese league team that he wants to play in Major League Baseball next season, but the team, Rakuten, does not want him to go.
abstract: Japanese pitching ace Masahiro Tanaka expresses wish to join Major League Baseball in 2014, but it remains unclear whether the Rakuten Golden Eagles will release him before he becomes free agent in 2015; decision could provide window into how Japanese teams will proceed following $20 million cap on compensation to teams whose players leave for the United States prematurely.
lead_paragraph: Pitcher Masahiro Tanaka told his Japanese league team that he wants to play in Major League Baseball next season, but the team, Rakuten, does not want him to go.

headline.main: Japan Star in Demand but Also in Limbo
headline.print_headline: Japan Star in Demand But Also in Limbo
